result.execSummary:
The defendant Jordan J Weber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: with Huber privileges.   IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess Huber funds be applied toward any and all outstanding restitution, fines/costs while serving his/her mandatory jail sentence.

miscConds.notes:
Pay restitution in the amount of $5,000.00 and restitution surcharge. The Defendant has deposited $2,843.00 into Attorney Kuehn's trust account and which will be disbursed to victim. The amount in excess of $2,843.00 is subject to challenge and the defendant may request a restitution hearing as to this amount.
----------------------------------
AMENDMENT - 09/27/2016 - Pursuant to restitution hearing held on 09/12/2016 and Order Adopting Findings of Fact and Conclusions of Law Filed on 09/26/2016, that given the agreement of the parties the victim's remaining damages are in the amount of $2,157.00 and the defendant has the ability to make restitution and shall be paid during the defendant's period of probation as directed by his probation agent or otherwise ordered by the Court.
----------------------------------

Pay court costs.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
----------------------------------

No alcohol. No contact with the victim Ryan Mezera.
----------------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.   Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.   The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
----------------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
----------------------------------

Court in session at 11:16 am. Attorney Haley Johnson appears for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Kuehn appears for defendant. Settlement agreement is addressed. Parties stipulate to remaining balance of $2157.00. Court will prepare Findings of Fact and Order. Court in recess. 11:19 a.m. Minutes filed.
Restitution hearing on September 12, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Parties agree to reset hearing. Victim will provide estimates of bills to State and Atty Kuehn. 
Court schedules internal review. If stipulation is not filed by noon on June 13th court will contact parties to determine status.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jordan J Weber in court with attorney Christopher Lyle Kuehn.  Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Preliminary hearing requested. Minutes filed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant in court. Atty McMiller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes Filed.
Signed bond filed with the court.
See signature bond set on 07-26-2015

MUST POST $500.00 CASH.  Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH R.T.M., G.W.C., S.M.B.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
